questions.text: Where were the 2012 Turtles at the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
In space.

	The Turtles had spent the first 9 episodes of the season floating around space and continued that trend in the beginning of this show. There were on Fugitoid's ship searching for the fourth piece to a device called a black hole generator.

questions.text: The 2012 Turtles were transported to the universe of the 1987 Turtles.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The 2012 Turtles made references to the 2D style of animation before Donnie mentioned they were likely in an alternate dimension. It was at that moment that the 1987 Turtles emerged from behind a water tower for the first ever meet-up between the two sets of Turtles. Midway through the episode they transported to the 2012 universe so both sets of Turtles got time in both universes. The 1987 version of the Turtles had made a cameo in a season 2 episode of the 2012 series, but the two sets of Turtles hadn't actually met up in that brief appearance.

questions.text: Which of the pairs of Turtles got along, while the three others tried to fight each other?
questions.explanation:
The Mikeys.

	2012 Raph claimed that 1987 Donnie had a laser and started a fight between the two sides. Each paired off with their own counterpart. The Leos, Raphs and Donnies fought, while the Mikeys each thought the other was "cool" and slapped each other five.

questions.text: Who brought the 2012 Turtles to the 1987 universe?
questions.explanation:
The 1987 Turtles.

	The machine 1987 Donnie had in his hand when the two groups met was a portal generator. The 1987 Turtles brought the 2012 Turtles to their world because they needed help fighting Krang.

questions.text: Which Turtle got upset when 1987 Leo took command of the combined team?
questions.explanation:
2012 Leo.

	1987 Leo told the two Dons to attacked Krang's planted weapon while the rest of the team focused on taking out Krang's Android Body. The 2012 Leo started to complain that he was the "order guy" but the others had already begun to act on his counterpart's plan.

questions.text: Which Turtle was the first to be seen eating pizza in this episode?
questions.explanation:
1987 Don.

	The episode was about half over before any of them were shown eating pizza. The scene where he grabbed a slice was when the eight Turtles all returned to the 2012 Turtles' lair.

questions.text: There were three identical "Dimensionizers" and they were all placed in the same location in different dimensions. Where were they?
options: In the home of Baxter Stockman.
questions.explanation:
On the Channel 6 news building.

	Of course the Channel 6 news building had a lot more meaning in the 1987 universe as April there worked as a reporter at the station. In the 2012 series she had been a scientist so the building had little meaning to the 2012 Turtles. The third dimension was the original comic book series.

questions.text: Which Turtle kept referring to himself as the "real" one?
questions.explanation:
1987 Raph.

	1987 Raph, despite being the more cartoony of the two, called himself the "real" one several times. 2012 Raph joked about it as he felt the 1987 version was inferior because they often fought without weapons.

questions.text: Which Turtle was sent to the "prime" dimension?
questions.explanation:
Don.

	The two Dons went on their own to track down the third weapon of Krang's. They met up with, but didn't get to talk to, their counterparts from the 1984 Mirage Studios comic.  The entire clip was about 2 minutes long and showed the two Dons flipping around through various black and white comic panels while outrunning the original Turtles.

questions.text: Where did the final battle with Krang take place?
questions.explanation:
2012 Technodrome.

	All of the Technodrome scenes were in the 2012 universe. At the end of the episode, the 1987 Turtles returned to their own dimension, but Tigerclaw also ended up there with them.
